articles.title: US Pass Grain Standards Reauthorization Act of 2025
articles.summary: The bipartisan US Grain Standards Reauthorization Act of 2025 has passed, mandating the USDA to prioritize the adoption of AI and automated grading technology. Critical administrative cost caps were removed to encourage investment in modern inspection equipment.

articles.title: USDA Releases FY2025-2026 AI Integration Strategy
articles.summary: The USDA has released its first comprehensive strategy for integrating Artificial Intelligence across its programs. The roadmap focuses on enhancing data-driven decision-making in FGIS inspection processes and improving operational efficiency.

articles.title: Ground Truth Ag Scales Real-Time Grading Manufacturing
articles.summary: Regina-based Ground Truth Agriculture is scaling manufacturing of its combine-mounted rapid grading units. The system, known for matching lab-quality NIRS analysis in real-time, is set for widespread distribution across Canada and the US for the 2026 harvest.

articles.title: AE50 Award: Foreign Material Detection Module Wins Big
articles.summary: A new 'Foreign Material Detection Module' utilizing advanced machine vision has won a 2025 AE50 Award. The system instantly detects imperfections in moving grain streams, significantly reducing reliance on subjective manual visual inspection.

articles.title: CGC Updates Official Grain Grading Guide for Soybeans
articles.summary: Effective August 1, 2024, the CGC has updated the Official Grain Grading Guide with clarity on soybean seed coat discolouration. The guide also introduces a user-friendly vertical formatting for grade determination tables.

articles.title: New 'Canada Western Food' Barley Designation Created
articles.summary: To support the growing food barley market, the CGC has implemented new designation lists for 'Barley, Canada Western Food', effective August 1, 2024. This move separates food varieties from general malting/feed classifications.

articles.title: ZoomAgri Raises $6M, Partnering with GrainCorp
articles.summary: Argentine agtech ZoomAgri has raised $6M in Series A funding led by GrainCorp. The partnership includes the deployment of 40+ 'ZoomOne' units across Australia for automated varietal purity testing.

articles.title: GoMicro Expands AI Quality Assessment to Lentils
articles.summary: Following success with leafy greens at Boratto Farms, South Australia's GoMicro is road-testing its phone-based AI grader on lentils. The handheld solution promises 'superhuman' consistency for impurity detection in the field.

articles.title: Grain Trade Australia Endorses AI for 2026/27 Certification
articles.summary: In a landmark decision, Grain Trade Australia has endorsed ZoomAgri's 'Zoom One' technology for official certification of barley varieties starting in the 2026/27 season, marking a major shift towards automated grading standards.
